Known for being a top school. Called the Ivy league of the South.
They are very personal. Amazing scholarships offered herre. Ask a question on the phone, and they'll give you a response immediately: no waits!

DeLand is affectionately known as the skydive capital of the world and Skydive Deland offers discounts to seniors during Senior Week. textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Join an on campus organization. If you do so, you will have plenty of friends and never be bored. Also, take advantage of the small class sizes. Classes can be challenging, but the professors are all very willing to help. Bang for the buck The major drawback for me is the cost of attendance. It is not cheap. Even after scholarships and grants, I still have to take out loans each semester to pay for school. This is not the case for all students though. Many do receive enough financial aid to attend Stetson for free. Am enjoying being here The biggest complaint that students have about Stetson, and DeLand in general, is that it is too quiet on the weekends. If you are really big into drinking and partying, Stetson may not be the school for you. However, I have always found that Stetson has plenty to offer for me. Every Friday night, the CSA puts on fun activities, there is always some place on campus to find free food, and it is easy to keep oneself busy with all the concerts, organizations, and sports teams on campus. As an added bonus, Stetson is about halfway between Orlando and Daytona Beach and it is not a long drive to either one.
